definition: to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at

sentences.english: Grace goes to the glass and looks the big fish in the eye.
sentences.chinese: 格蕾絲邊說邊走到玻璃前盯視着這條大魚。

sentences.english: Famous people get used to the stares of the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 出了名的人習慣於人羣的盯視。

sentences.english: The new world stared at the old.
Most people become uncomfortable under the intense gaze of a stare.
sentences.chinese: 多數人在受到別人目光盯視時會感到很不舒服。

sentences.english: There are ways, of course, to avoid Google's gaze.
sentences.chinese: 當然了，有許多方法可以避免Google的盯視。

sentences.english: A fury snake overarching was looking at us.
sentences.chinese: 一條弓起身子狂怒的蛇在盯視着我們。

sentences.english: He just lay there and stared.
